get.summary: gets a description text identtified by its tei:div@xml:id
get.description: By passing the appropriate xml-ID and xslt you can retrieve ready to display html

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: the @xml:id of the tei:div xml element

parameters.name: xslt
parameters.description: the filename of the xslt transformation (for development purposes only)

html.value:
Sample Texts (Explanation)

 {teiLink}

The sample texts are translations of the same source text. They vary slightly with respect to regional differences. However, they are homogeneous enough to allow students to compare the numerous linguistic phenomena displayed in the texts.

Sofar we provide sample texts for six locations:

  • Baghdad
  • Cairo
  • Damascus
  • Douz
  • Şanlıurfa
  • Tunis

parameters.description: the filename of the xslt transformation (for development purposes only)

html.value:
Skoura

 {teiLink}
Courtesy of Stephan Procházka, 2012
MSA Name سكورة
MSA Name (trans.) Sakūra Skūra
Geo location 31°03'N 06°33'W Morocco
Contributed by Aleksandra Ercegovčević
Typology
West (Maghreb) › Morocco › Central type
Hilalian-type sedentary rural dialect with strong influence of Berber
General
Skūra is an Arabic enclave in the Berber-speaking area south of the High Atlas. Many of the 15,000 inhabitants are bilingual. They live mainly on agriculture and stock breeding.
Research History
All available data on the dialect of Skūra is from the work of Jorge Aguadé and Mohammad Elyaâcoubi. Aguadé 1994 is a brief study on the formation of the reflexive-passive forms of the verb. Aguadé and Elyaacoubi 1995 is a monograph on the dialect with chapters on phonology, nominal and verbal morphology, and verb paradigms. Aguadé et al. 1996 deals with the irrigation system in the oasis of Skūra, and the technical terminology concerning irrigation in the dialect of Skūra. Elyaâcoubi 1998 treats the topic of the classification of south Moroccan Arabic dialects on the example of Skūra, where a three page-grammatical sketch of the dialect is also provided.
Dictionaries
Aguadé et al. 1996 includes a 2-page glossary of terminology related to the irrigation system (xiṭṭāra).
Bibliography
To view publications on this variety click here.

get.description: Retrieve geo data information from the bibliography for displaying coordinates on a map.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description:
A BaseX Full-Text search query in in vicav-biblio tei:biblstruct with wildcards enabled.
See: https://docs.basex.org/wiki/Full-Text#Match_Options
using wildcards using diacritics sensitive
Uses prefixes to limit the full text search to certein elements.
* date: -> tei:date
* title: -> tei:title
* pubPlace: -> tei:pubPlace
* author: -> tei:author/tei:surname
* geo:, geo_reg:, reg:, diaGroup: -> tei:note[@type="tag"]/tei:name
* vt:, prj: -> tei:note[@type="tag"]

Without a prefix any text in vicav-biblio tei:biblstruct is searched.

More than one query is possible by separating with ' '/+.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description:
Filters based on a set of tei:name/@types being present in a tei:note[tei:geo]           
* geo
* diaGroup
* reg
* geo_reg: any of the above

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: a reference to a predefined query for markers on a map

xml.value:
<rs>
  <r type="geo" xml:id="baghdad_sample_01">
    <loc>33°20'N 44°24'E</loc>
    <locName>
      <name xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" xml:lang="eng">Baghdad</name>
    </locName>
    <alt>
      <name xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" xml:lang="eng">Baghdad</name>
    </alt>
    <freq>1</freq>
  </r>
  <r type="geo" xml:id="cairo_sample_01">
    <loc>30°03'N 31°14'E</loc>
    <locName>
      <name xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" xml:lang="eng">Cairo</name>
    </locName>
    <alt>
      <name xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" xml:lang="eng">Cairo</name>
    </alt>
    <freq>1</freq>
  </r>
</rs>

get.description: A pageable set of corpus utterances from the given text.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Corpus text ID

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: How many results to retrieve in one query. Defaults to 10.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number to retrieve. Defaults to 1.

parameters.name: hits
parameters.description: Comma-separated token IDs to highlight

parameters.name: print
parameters.description: Whether to retrieve a full HTML file with printer-friendly formatting.
